discussions.message:

This approach ensures compliance with regulations and fosters patient trust, enabling confident engagement with healthcare technology.

Instructions to complete this assignment

If you're working in a collaborative team, discuss your findings together in a group setting to gain insight from others on how you can most effectively assess your organization’s AI readiness. 

  1. Answer the questions by selecting the most appropriate response.
    • Each question has four answer options, each assigned a score from 1 to 4. To calculate the readiness score, add the scores for all eight questions.
    • The purpose of this assignment is to bring your perspective in line with the current state of your healthcare facility’s readiness for AI tools. 
  2. Interpret your score.
    • 8-16: Low Readiness
    • 17-24: Moderate Readiness
    • 25-32: High Readiness
    • 33-40: Very High Readiness
  3. Print to PDF to save your document with your answers (so your answers aren't lost)!

discussions.title: (Intro 3 of 11) Discussion: Customer Experience Lessons
discussions.message:
First, download the poster

---- start grid -----

Here are 5 lessons your professors have learned through the school of hard knocks about spiriting CX. There are plenty more on this discussion poster!

  1. Customer Experience is built (or not) into your brand. Beloved companies know this well and are capitalizing on other's lack of understanding its importance.
  2. Not everyone in your organization will automatically put customers first. Nor will they intuitively understand why Customer Experience is strategically critical to business success.
  3. Customer Experience is political. It may take brute force to keep it in front of power grabs, short-term revenue heists, individual self-interest takeovers, and persuasive soft-cost mentality.
  4. Customer Experience is cultural. It will take all your employees working together to achieve success.
  5. The majority of so-called "business problems" are actually Customer Experience problems.
---- start button -----

CX Lessons Learned Through Hard Knocks

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

  1. What's a lesson you've personally learned or experienced?
  2. How might you approach it differently going forward?
  3. Let's encourage each other by making suggestions others will find helpful - comment on at least one other student.

discussions.title: (Strategy 8 of 16) Discussion: Guiding CX Visions
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, consider this

A well-crafted CX vision statement can differentiate your brand from competitors and serves as a benchmark for measuring progress in delivering exceptional customer experiences. But, how do you feel about it? How can a CX vision impact YOUR employees? Can it align your teams, motivate, and help to ensure consistency in customer interactions?

Now, let's discuss!

  1. Do you feel a Customer Experience Vision could / will greatly impact your organization?
  2. Consider the vision you created - would your mailroom employee be able to recite it? (Easy, short, memorable, impactful.) How about your company's president?
  3. What would be the best ways to communicate your vision at your company?
  4. Let's encourage each other by making suggestions others will find helpful - reply to at least one other student.

If you wish, share your vision here!

 

---- end grid -----

discussions.title: (Strategy 14 of 16) Discussion: Roadblocks & Ideas
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, download the poster

Customer Experience is all about changing the way you do business. Embracing a customer-centric approach can truly transform your relationship with your customers and lead to a significant cultural shift. However, because it often goes against traditional business processes and operations, implementing these changes can be quite challenging for any organization. Let's talk about these roadblocks.

Grab your copy of this discussion poster and open a dialogue on leadership, unity, and empowerment to transform your customer experiences!

---- start button -----

Overcoming CX Roadblocks

---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

  1. What type of roadblocks do YOU run up against when trying to drive success with customer experience initiatives? (If not you, maybe you see this happen to others.)
  2. Share with us what you've found helpful to overcome and gain success.
  3. Let's encourage each other by making suggestions others will find helpful - reply to at least one other!

Embracing a customer-centric approach can truly transform your relationship with your customers and lead to a significant cultural shift. However, because it often goes against traditional business processes and operations, implementing these changes can be quite challenging for any organization. Let's talk about these roadblocks.

Grab your copy of this discussion poster and open a dialogue on leadership, unity, and empowerment to transform your customer experiences!

---- start button -----

Overcoming CX Roadblocks

---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

  1. What type of roadblocks do YOU run up against when trying to drive success with customer experience initiatives? (If not you, maybe you see this happen to others.)
  2. Share with us what you've found helpful to overcome and gain success.
  3. Let's encourage each other by making suggestions others will find helpful - reply to at least one other!
assignment.name: (Strategy 14 of 16) Discussion: Roadblocks & Ideas

discussions.title: (Journey 7 of 15) Discussion: Customer Persona Strategies
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read the article

Personas help CX teams improve customer focus, as they get a better understanding of customer goals, expectations, preferences, motivations, and pain points and can accordingly develop strategies to align their products, services, teams and interactions. In a nutshell, personas are the key to delivering personalized, empathetic, and consistently outstanding customer experiences.

---- start button -----

How Personas Help Deliver Exceptional CX

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Next, download the poster

Successful use of customer experience personas involves avoiding overgeneralization, static representations, neglect of emotional insights, overlooking negative personas, and not connecting employees to relatable personas, while emphasizing collaborative, cross-functional efforts for a cohesive and resonant customer experience.

Grab this poster for 6 pitfalls to avoid for persona success!

---- start button -----

6 Reasons Why Personas Fail

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

  1. Do you currently use CX personas with your project teams, and if so, how do they help?
  2. During your next project, what do you think would happen if you started the kick-off with a persona workshop - and each person on the team created their own customer persona to represent throughout the project?
  3. What might your own strategy be when it comes to using personas?
  4. Let's remember to support each other. Reply to another student and encourage their ideas!

discussions.title: (Innovation 14 of 20) Discussion: Can We Move Mountains with Empathy Stories?
discussions.message:
First, watch the video

Why not just data dump? Won't that be enough to motivate everyone? While data provides facts, crafting an emotional story can captivate, engage, and inspire action. A compelling story can help your employees understand their own significance and purpose. This video provides a unique look at data dumping!

Now, let's discuss!

A well-crafted empathy story not only conveys information, but it becomes more memorable and impactful than data alone. It can motivate teams, stakeholders, and leaders to take meaningful action for innovation!

  1. Do you think the technique of using empathy stories will help your employees take meaningful action? Will they connect and want to wave their magic wand to innovate on behalf of customers?
  2. What other ways might these poignant stories be helpful?

discussions.title: (Culture 2 of 20) Discussion: Our Precious Culture
discussions.message:
First, watch the video

Consider how your work culture treats customers. Are they provided the "personal touch" they deserve as they transition from one channel to the next? Or, is each interaction disjointed? Are they just a number?

---- start grid -----

Next, download the poster

This poster serves as a visual reminder of the positive aspects found within a customer-first culture, aligning the team on empathy, communications, collaboration, learning, feedback, customer-centric actions, customer stories, and recognition.

As you review each item, does it sound like your own culture? Download a copy for this discussion, and perhaps print and post to reinforce your organization's commitment,  remind employees of their contribution to fostering a customer-first culture, and facilitate a quick understanding of desired behaviors!

---- start button -----

Things We Like - Things We Can Change

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

Cultivating a customer-centric mindset across a team is a challenge, let alone an entire company! Consider the different departments and channels customers experience (website, phone, ordering, support, apps, payments, etc.) as you discuss the following:

  1. Does your culture ever treat customers like a number? Maybe not to their face, but what about internal conversations during project meetings and when making product decisions?
  2. What’s the top thing you love about your culture?
  3. What’s the top thing you’d like to change about your culture?

discussions.title: (Culture 9 of 20) Discussion: Wave Your Magic Wand for Success!
discussions.message:
First, watch the video

Zappos is well known for their investment in culture. As you watch this video, think about the impact of their core values.

Next, download the poster

---- start grid -----

An important message around Zappos' core values revolves around the profound belief that delivering exceptional customer service is not just a business strategy but a way of life. Zappos' commitment to its core values, including "Deliver WOW Through Service," "Embrace and Drive Change," and "Create Fun and A Little Weirdness," communicates a vibrant and customer-centric ethos. The message here is clear: Zappos strives to go beyond transactional interactions and aims to create memorable, delightful experiences for its customers.

By fostering a culture that values innovation, embraces change, and injects an element of fun into the customer experience, Zappos sets a standard for not just selling products but for building lasting connections and cultivating a brand that customers love. The core values underscore the idea that, at Zappos, each team member plays a crucial role in shaping a customer-focused culture, where service isn't just a task but a passion-driven commitment to making customers say, "WOW!"

---- start button -----

Zappos Core Values

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

Think about how your future culture and what values would help mold your team, attract the best, finest and brightest to join your company, and encourage everyone to be absolutely fanatical about your customers.

  1. Of Zappos 10 core values, which one would you most like to bring to your own company?
  2. In your future culture, what will be your TOP core value? You can rewrite a current value to add meaning or create a new one that will resonate with your Customer First Culture.
  3. Why will career seekers want to work at your company? What is the biggest “wow” that will have them beating down your doors to join your organization?

discussions.title: (Culture 11 of 20) Discussion: Customer First Habits
discussions.message:
First, watch the video

Now, let's discuss!

The last thing you want your customers to hear is "Yes, I know how long you’ve been holding and I don’t care". Hopefully your employees never convey this message! However, while it may not be phrased in these words exactly, are your employees embracing a "customer-last" culture? Consider the "habits" from this and previous videos.

  2. Identify 2 new habits you want to see grow in your employees.
  3. Let's encourage each other by making suggestions others will find helpful - comment on at least one other student.

discussions.title: (Politics 4 of 17) Discussion: Why is CX Important to YOUR Company?
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read the article

Why's CX crucial? In the face of a changing world, it's more vital than ever to anticipate potential shifts shaping the experience landscape. With recent events, rapid technological advancements, shifts in consumer behavior, and evolving expectations, it's essential for businesses to proactively adapt, ensuring they stay ahead in the competitive arena. Read more.

---- start button -----

Customer Experience Trends

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Next, download the poster

We've extracted the 8 forecasted trends from the article for your reference. As mentioned, Customer experience is no longer limited to a single department. It's evolved into a comprehensive ethos that (should) permeate every aspect of an organization. Today, businesses are harnessing the capabilities of data analytics, artificial intelligence, and personalized interactions to create seamless, meaningful, and consistent experiences that resonate with their diverse customer base.

---- start button -----

What's on the Horizon

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

  1. Why do you personally feel customer experience is critical to your company - and do you think your top business leaders agree?
  2. Of the trends mentioned in the article, which one would add the most value for your customers and improve revenue? Why?
  3. As always, it's wonderful to support each other. Please encourage at least one other in this discussion!

discussions.title: (Politics 7 of 17) Discussion: Welcome To The Experience Economy!
discussions.message:
First, watch the video:

Joe Pine, author of "The Experience Economy: Competing for Customer Time, Attention, and Money", demonstrates how goods and services are no longer enough; what companies must offer today are experiences – memorable events that engage each customer in an inherently personal way.

---- start grid -----

Next, download the poster

Inspired by Joe Pine's profound insights into the experience economy, this graphic illustrates the transformative shift from traditional commodities to the pinnacle of value - experiences. From basic commodities to enhanced goods and services, all the way to the apex of memorable experiences, businesses can navigate this progression to not just meet but exceed customer expectations.

---- start button -----

Progression of Economic Value

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

Are you setting the stage to be commoditization or economically rewarded? Consider Pine's perspective on the progression of economic value.

  1. Do you feel your company's efforts align with ensuring customers feel their experiences were "time well spent" versus "time well saved"? Why?
  2. In a world where customers are acquiring expectations against the global stage, describe one way your own organization can break through the clutter with unique and memorable experiences.
  3. What was the biggest "aha" moment you took away from Pine's presentation?

discussions.title: (Politics 17 of 17) Discussion: How Will YOU Apply YOUR Learnings?
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

We're so happy you joined us!

There's just a few more pages to go and the program will be at its end. Let's look back at what you've learned:

You gained an appreciation for CX and what it means to earn the right to be a beloved brand. You assessed your company's CX maturity level, formulated your vision and goals, developed personas, and took your customers on a journey. You learned how to apply data to your strategy, discovered how empathy stories can bring teams together to innovate, considered the customer relationship you wish to build, and did a wonderful job exploring ideas to help engage your culture. Lastly, you put together an executive presentation to help affect change, and completed a personal action plan to empower your own influence and leadership. Wow - that's quite an achievement!

---- end grid -----

Our final discussion!

Consider this program and your accomplishments for our conversation.

  1. What do you think might be your main challenge in bringing CX success to your organization?"
  2. How will you apply your learnings? For example, what will be your top CX priority, your first action to take, an initiative you feel passionate about?
  3. What was your favorite "aha" or surprising moment you'd like to share with others?
  4. What is your biggest takeaway?
  5. Please say farewell to your fellow classmates by providing them with your favorite CX tip to the "Path of CX Excellence".

discussions.title: (Politics 2 of 17) Discussion: Expectations and Customer Experience
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read the article

As customers, we all hold expectations. These expectations can be shaped by past experiences, fostering the anticipation that future interactions will unfold similarly. On other occasions, our expectations are influenced by our personal vision, where we incorporate biases, desires, and needs, forming a mental picture of the desired outcome. This dynamic interplay between personal expectations and customer experiences underscores the significance of meeting (and sometimes exceeding) customer expectations.

---- start button -----

How Expectations Affect Customer Experience

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Next, download the poster

---- start grid -----

Our customers form expectations based on various factors such as brand promises, previous interactions, and industry standards. When businesses exceed expectations by providing exceptional service, it not only enhances customer satisfaction but also fosters loyalty and positive word-of-mouth, ultimately driving profitability. For example, my story about DoorDash!

Staying adaptable to changing expectations and continuously improving processes are essential strategies in today's world.

---- start button -----

Ways to Exceed Customer Expectations

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

  1. As businesses, how can we proactively identify and understand the diverse expectations of our customers?
  2. What strategies or tools does your organization use understand when there's a gap between customer expectations and the actual experiences you've deliver?
  3. Share your thoughts on how businesses can foster a culture that consistently meets or exceeds customer expectations.

A well-crafted CX vision statement can differentiate your brand from competitors and serves as a benchmark for measuring progress in delivering exceptional customer experiences. ---- start grid -----

Here are 5 lessons your professors have learned through the school of hard knocks about spiriting CX. There are plenty more on this discussion poster!

  1. Customer Experience is built (or not) into your brand. Beloved companies know this well and are capitalizing on other's lack of understanding its importance.
  2. Not everyone in your organization will automatically put customers first. Nor will they intuitively understand why Customer Experience is strategically critical to business success.
  3. Customer Experience is political. It may take brute force to keep it in front of power grabs, short-term revenue heists, individual self-interest takeovers, and persuasive soft-cost mentality.
  4. Customer Experience is cultural. It will take all your employees working together to achieve success.
  5. The majority of so-called "business problems" are actually Customer Experience problems.
---- start button -----

CX Lessons Learned Through Hard Knocks

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

  1. What's a lesson you've personally learned or experienced?
  2. How might you approach it differently going forward?
  3. Let's encourage each other by making suggestions others will find helpful - comment on at least one other student.

Why not just data dump? Won't that be enough to motivate everyone? While data provides facts, crafting an emotional story can captivate, engage, and inspire action. A compelling story can help your employees understand their own significance and purpose. This video provides a unique look at data dumping!

A well-crafted empathy story not only conveys information, but it becomes more memorable and impactful than data alone. It can motivate teams, stakeholders, and leaders to take meaningful action for innovation!

  1. Do you think the technique of using empathy stories will help your employees take meaningful action? Will they connect and want to wave their magic wand to innovate on behalf of customers?

assignments.description:
First, watch the video

Consider how your work culture treats customers. Are they provided the "personal touch" they deserve as they transition from one channel to the next? Or, is each interaction disjointed? Are they just a number?

---- start grid -----

Next, download the poster

This poster serves as a visual reminder of the positive aspects found within a customer-first culture, aligning the team on empathy, communications, collaboration, learning, feedback, customer-centric actions, customer stories, and recognition.

As you review each item, does it sound like your own culture? Download a copy for this discussion, and perhaps print and post to reinforce your organization's commitment,  remind employees of their contribution to fostering a customer-first culture, and facilitate a quick understanding of desired behaviors!

---- start button -----

Things We Like - Things We Can Change

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

Cultivating a customer-centric mindset across a team is a challenge, let alone an entire company! Consider the different departments and channels customers experience (website, phone, ordering, support, apps, payments, etc.) as you discuss the following:

  1. Does your culture ever treat customers like a number? Maybe not to their face, but what about internal conversations during project meetings and when making product decisions?
  2. What’s the top thing you love about your culture?
  3. What’s the top thing you’d like to change about your culture?

assignments.description:
First, watch the video

Zappos is well known for their investment in culture. As you watch this video, think about the impact of their core values.

Next, download the poster

---- start grid -----

An important message around Zappos' core values revolves around the profound belief that delivering exceptional customer service is not just a business strategy but a way of life. Zappos' commitment to its core values, including "Deliver WOW Through Service," "Embrace and Drive Change," and "Create Fun and A Little Weirdness," communicates a vibrant and customer-centric ethos. The message here is clear: Zappos strives to go beyond transactional interactions and aims to create memorable, delightful experiences for its customers.

By fostering a culture that values innovation, embraces change, and injects an element of fun into the customer experience, Zappos sets a standard for not just selling products but for building lasting connections and cultivating a brand that customers love. The core values underscore the idea that, at Zappos, each team member plays a crucial role in shaping a customer-focused culture, where service isn't just a task but a passion-driven commitment to making customers say, "WOW!"

---- start button -----

Zappos Core Values

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

Think about how your future culture and what values would help mold your team, attract the best, finest and brightest to join your company, and encourage everyone to be absolutely fanatical about your customers.

  1. Of Zappos 10 core values, which one would you most like to bring to your own company?
  2. In your future culture, what will be your TOP core value? You can rewrite a current value to add meaning or create a new one that will resonate with your Customer First Culture.
  3. Why will career seekers want to work at your company? What is the biggest “wow” that will have them beating down your doors to join your organization?

assignments.description:
---- start grid -----

First, read the article

Why's CX crucial? In the face of a changing world, it's more vital than ever to anticipate potential shifts shaping the experience landscape. With recent events, rapid technological advancements, shifts in consumer behavior, and evolving expectations, it's essential for businesses to proactively adapt, ensuring they stay ahead in the competitive arena. Read more.

---- start button -----

Customer Experience Trends

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Next, download the poster

We've extracted the 8 forecasted trends from the article for your reference. As mentioned, Customer experience is no longer limited to a single department. It's evolved into a comprehensive ethos that (should) permeate every aspect of an organization. Today, businesses are harnessing the capabilities of data analytics, artificial intelligence, and personalized interactions to create seamless, meaningful, and consistent experiences that resonate with their diverse customer base.

---- start button -----

What's on the Horizon

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

  1. Why do you personally feel customer experience is critical to your company - and do you think your top business leaders agree?
  2. Of the trends mentioned in the article, which one would add the most value for your customers and improve revenue? Why?
  3. As always, it's wonderful to support each other. Please encourage at least one other in this discussion!

assignments.description:
---- start grid -----

First, read the article

As customers, we all hold expectations. These expectations can be shaped by past experiences, fostering the anticipation that future interactions will unfold similarly. On other occasions, our expectations are influenced by our personal vision, where we incorporate biases, desires, and needs, forming a mental picture of the desired outcome. This dynamic interplay between personal expectations and customer experiences underscores the significance of meeting (and sometimes exceeding) customer expectations.

---- start button -----

How Expectations Affect Customer Experience

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Next, download the poster

---- start grid -----

Our customers form expectations based on various factors such as brand promises, previous interactions, and industry standards. When businesses exceed expectations by providing exceptional service, it not only enhances customer satisfaction but also fosters loyalty and positive word-of-mouth, ultimately driving profitability. For example, my story about DoorDash!

Staying adaptable to changing expectations and continuously improving processes are essential strategies in today's world.

---- start button -----

Ways to Exceed Customer Expectations

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

  1. As businesses, how can we proactively identify and understand the diverse expectations of our customers?
  2. What strategies or tools does your organization use understand when there's a gap between customer expectations and the actual experiences you've deliver?
  3. Share your thoughts on how businesses can foster a culture that consistently meets or exceeds customer expectations.

Understanding the business ecosystem is essential in crafting customer-centric strategies, mitigating risks, seizing opportunities, and maintaining a competitive edge. Understanding your relationship to other departments and stakeholders and how that impacts the customer's experience is crucial. It helps align your business practices with the broader context, ultimately ensuring a positive and enduring customer experience. Download this poster for this discussion!

assignments.description:
First, watch the video:

Joe Pine, author of "The Experience Economy: Competing for Customer Time, Attention, and Money", demonstrates how goods and services are no longer enough; what companies must offer today are experiences – memorable events that engage each customer in an inherently personal way.

---- start grid -----

Next, download the poster

Inspired by Joe Pine's profound insights into the experience economy, this graphic illustrates the transformative shift from traditional commodities to the pinnacle of value - experiences. From basic commodities to enhanced goods and services, all the way to the apex of memorable experiences, businesses can navigate this progression to not just meet but exceed customer expectations.

---- start button -----

Progression of Economic Value

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

Are you setting the stage to be commoditization or economically rewarded? Consider Pine's perspective on the progression of economic value.

  1. Do you feel your company's efforts align with ensuring customers feel their experiences were "time well spent" versus "time well saved"? Why?
  2. In a world where customers are acquiring expectations against the global stage, describe one way your own organization can break through the clutter with unique and memorable experiences.
  3. What was the biggest "aha" moment you took away from Pine's presentation?

assignments.description:
General Downloading and Submitting instructions

  • How to Download and Submit Assignments

Step 1 - Download the worksheet

---- start grid -----

We can learn a lot from other workplace cultures. In this assignment, you'll review at least 3 videos about company cultures. These videos are often created to recruit new employees, thus they usually represent their desired culture vision. After reviewing the videos, you'll complete a "Me Likey" exercise with 3 questions: Most like you, Least like you, and Something You’d Like to bring to your own culture!

  1. Start by downloading the document.
  2. Save it to your desktop so you can edit it.
---- start button -----

Culture Videos – Me Likey!

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Step 2 - Review three videos

  1. Review at least three (3) of these interesting videos that describe a work culture.
  2. Try to select videos most like your own company, or videos you feel particularly interested in.
---- start grid -----

Apple - Inclusion & diversity
Apple’s video starts with a unifying word, “open,” to summarize their desired culture.

BambooHR - Values & Mission
BambooHR fosters a culture that puts customer experience at the heart of everything they do.

---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Bank of America - Culture
BofA employees discuss the environment of trust, engagement, diversity, and inclusion.

Bank of America - Our People
This video focuses on the BofA purpose and the key to driving responsible growth.

---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Basecamp - Remote Teams
Formerly known as 37signals, Basecamp makes sure candidates understand its remote-work process.

Blackbaud - Values & Mission
Their credo: "Powered by people passionate about making an impact..."

---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Dropbox - Work-life Balance
Employees from diverse backgrounds and lifestyles focus on promoting a healthy work-life balance.

Fiverr - Culture Video "Satire"
The company shows their humorous side by satirizing generic recruitment videos.

---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Fuze - C-Suite on Culture
Their most senior leaders, including the Executive Chairman and CEO, discuss company culture.

Golden Hippo - Work-life Balance
This video focuses on health and wellness, work-life balance, and being a cool company.

---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Hubspot - Company Culture
Hubspot highlights their office atmosphere and the things that people enjoy about working there.

Hubspot - Product Team
Hubspot spotlights what it's like to work on of their teams to develop products.

---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Intuit - Diversity
This Intuit video focuses on inclusion and diversity of their employees.

Intuit - Sustainability & Values
By embracing sustainable practices, Intuit focuses on what it means to be green.

---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Lululemon - Culture & Work-life Balance
Committed people who care for each other and enjoy a supportive company.

Microsoft - Workplace Culture
Employees discuss the impact they make, passion projects, training, inclusion, and flexibility.

---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

PatientPoint - Learning Culture
PatientPoint fosters employee engagement through learning organization methodologies.

REI - Culture of Opportunities
REI provides an environment of respect, diversity, shared values and a passion for the outdoors

---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Salesforce - Blazing the culture trail
The Salesforce culture is an organization excelling via leadership and personal commitment.

Samsara - Safety Culture
Samsara believes in a more sustainable future and in changing the world.

---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

SOPHiA GENETICS - Culture
They're more than AI and data, they believe in building something bigger.

Spotify - Values
They embrace mission, beliefs, culture, values, and everything else in between.

---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Toast - Culture
Feeling part of the communicaty and empowering each other is part of the "multigrain" recipe at Toast.

TOMS - Customer Service Culture
A relaxed culture of friendship, giving back to the community, and to each other.

---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

YMCA - Culture & Diversity
Offering a sense of community, belonging, purpose, and a mission of helping the community.

Zoom - Culture
"Delivering happiness", driving change, and providing connections for their remote workers.

---- end grid -----

Step 3 - Complete the assignment

  1. Complete the assignment by following the instructions in the worksheet. Using the 3 videos:
    • Describe what's Most Like You - something you found that is like your company today,
    • Least Like You - this would probably not work with your organization, and
    • Something You’d Like Now - this is you "me likey", a culture idea you wish your company would support right away!
  2. Save your document to upload. We don't want you to lose your work!
  3. To submit your results, refer to the instructions, click on [Start Assignment] and follow the upload steps.

Thank you!

assignments.description:
General assignment directions

  • How to Download and Submit Assignments

Download the worksheet

---- start grid -----

What data do you know about your own customers? This fast-paced exercise encourages quick thinking and emphasizes the importance of capturing essential customer data efficiently. In just three minutes, you're compelled to focus on the most critical information that shapes your understanding of your customers. It trains you to prioritize data, making it a valuable skill in the fast-paced world of CX where quick decision-making is often essential. Moreover, this exercise sets the stage for deeper customer analysis and persona development, helping you build a more profound connection with your audience and tailor your CX strategies to their needs.

---- start button -----

What Do You Know About Your Customers?

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Instructions to complete this assignment

  1. Start by downloading the document.
  2. Save it to your desktop so you can edit it.
  3. Complete the assignment by following the instructions in the worksheet.
    • In just 3 minutes - yes 3 minutes! - write down all of the things you currently know about your customer. For example, their email addresses, state, age, etc.
    • Try to fill the big question mark!
  4. Save your completed document. We don't want you to lose your work!
  5. To submit your results, refer to the instructions, click on [Start Assignment] and follow the upload steps.

Thank you!
assignments.name: (Journey 2 of 15) Assignment 1: What Do You Know About Your Customers?

assignments.description:
General assignment directions

  • How to Download and Submit Assignments

Download the worksheet

---- start grid -----

In this "Who is your Customer?" assignment, you'll dig deep into your customers' humanity, understanding their feelings, needs, and daily frustrations with your services. This is crucial as it fosters empathy, helps you see customers as unique individuals, and uncovers insights for improving CX. Plus, the "magic wand" part encourages your creative side - coming up with solutions to make their experience better.

All in all, you're humanizing customers and driving innovation for outstanding CX!

---- start button -----

Who is Your Customer?

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Instructions to complete this assignment

For this exercise, you'll "group" a segment of your customers to focus on. Of course you have more than 1 customer - most of us do. Just pick the segment you wish to target. Note: This customer will be the focus for your upcoming journey exercise!

  1. Start by downloading the document.
  2. Save it to your desktop so you can edit it.
  3. Complete the assignment by following the instructions in the worksheet.
    • Describe your typical customer (the one you'll focus on during the journey exercise).
      • Think about your customer from the "human" side.
      • They may be similar to you - they're busy, they have a life!
      • What are they doing during the day?
      • How does your service or product fit in?
  4. Save your completed document. We don't want you to lose your work!
  5. To submit your results, refer to the instructions, click on [Start Assignment] and follow the upload steps.

Thank you!
assignments.name: (Journey 4 of 15) Assignment 2: Who is Your Customer?

assignments.description:
General assignment directions

  • How to Download and Submit Assignments

Download the template

---- start grid -----

Customer experience personas are essential because they make your customers relatable and real. They enable you empathize with them and to understand their unique needs, preferences, and challenges, allowing you to tailor services accordingly. They also ensure that everyone across your organization has a unified understanding, promoting consistency in the customer journey. 

---- start button -----

Customer Experience Persona

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Instructions to complete this assignment

Remember to dig into the details of your customer. This exercise may take 20 - 30 minutes to complete.

  1. Start by downloading the document.
  2. Save it to your desktop so you can edit it.
  3. Complete the assignment by following the instructions in the worksheet. The Persona template is found on page1. Photos to use are found on the subsequent pages.
    • Select the photo that nearest represents your customers. You can also use another photo you may have! Copy and paste it into the Persona template.
    • Complete each section on page 1. Try to convey the "human emotional" side of your customer.
    • Include a quote that may have come from them. If you don't have one from feedback, create your own that embodies their feelings.
      • Put yourself in their shoes - what would they say?
      • Ideally, you would use feedback you really have about this customer. Are they happy with your services? Unhappy?
  4. Save your completed document. We don't want you to lose your work!
  5. To submit your results, refer to the instructions, click on [Start Assignment] and follow the upload steps.

Thank you!
assignments.name: (Journey 6 of 15) Assignment 3: Customer Experience Persona

assignments.name: (Journey 15 of 15) Knowledge Challenge: Module Wrap Up

assignments.description:
General assignment directions

  • How to Download and Submit Assignments

Download the worksheet

---- start grid -----

Customer experience journey maps are essential because they offer a holistic view of the customer's interactions, helping teams better understand the overall experience. The first step is to identify the internal impression at a high-level. This will help you gather your cross-departmental team (support, operations, marketing, etc.), and create a foundation for the basic journey.

Journey mapping is a team sport. This map can become your unifying tool, allowing you to bring the initial team together so they can join in for the deep dive! These are one of the best tools to break down silos, get the conversation going, and get everyone in unison for the right cause!

---- start button -----

The High-Level Journey Map

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Instructions to complete this assignment

For this exercise, pick a small journey at your company to investigate. (Don't try to bite off too big of a chunk!) Examples include a webinar or marketing campaign, onboarding a new customer, setting up payment accounts and making first payment, or finding and ordering a small appliance. For those of you in storefront environments, remember to include digital and in-store components. For those exploring employee journeys, think about recruitment, onboarding, first year at company, employee events, and those types of poignant journeys.

  1. Start by downloading the document.
  2. Save it to your desktop so you can edit it.
  3. Complete the assignment by following the instructions in the worksheet.
    • Pick a journey your persona customer has with your company.
    • Give your journey a name.
    • Identify the touchpoints. Only include interactions from your customer's viewpoint. To help, start each touchpoint with your customer persona's name. For example, "Sally gets webinar invitation", "Sally registers for webinar" - NOT "We prepare the email", "We send the webinar invitation", "We set up the registration page".
      • Remember all channels, not just digital and websites.
      • Include emails, phone calls, support interactions, tradeshows, face to face meetings, Social Media conversations, white papers, collateral and flyers, etc.
  4. Save your completed document. We don't want you to lose your work!
  5. To submit your results, refer to the instructions, click on [Start Assignment] and follow the upload steps.

Thank you!
assignments.name: (Journey 9 of 15) Assignment 4: The High-Level Journey Map

assignments.description:
General assignment directions

  • How to Download and Submit Assignments

Download the worksheet

---- start grid -----

Get ready to craft a detailed journey map that digs deep into each touchpoint of the customer experience. This exercise is all about examining the nitty-gritty details, including the specific channels, customer actions, emotions, questions, concerns, and roadblocks encountered along the way. By dissecting these interactions, you'll uncover insights that can drive meaningful improvements. Additionally, you'll have the opportunity to brainstorm and propose solutions to enhance each touchpoint, ensuring a smoother and more satisfying customer journey.

---- end grid -----

Detailed journey maps are your key to refining the experience and creating strategies that truly resonate with your audience!

---- start button -----

Detailed Journey Map Template

---- end button -----

Instructions to complete this assignment

To make using this document easy, we've created it in PowerPoint and placed all icons into a small tray at the bottom. Just enter the details and drag & drop the icons! (To make a copy of the icons, hold [Ctrl] (or Command) while dragging.) See this Student Example.

---- start grid -----
  1. Start by downloading the document.
  2. Save it to your desktop so you can edit it.
  3. Complete the assignment by following the instructions in the worksheet. In PowerPoint, zoom out and look at the sides for additional notes.
    • Add the name of your Journey. For "Facilitator", add your own name.
    • Transfer the name of the touchpoints from your High-Level Map.
      • Remember to start each touchpoint with the name of your persona customer.
      • Detail all touchpoints, adding emoticon images to clearly articulate the feelings your customers have at each point.
      • Try to stand in your customer's shoes. Use your best guess.
    • Ideally, to do this right you'd have real feedback from customers about this journey.
    • In the future, you might capture your customer's "reality" via surveys, focus groups, interviews, reviews, complaints, and from your front-line employees (those with direct contact to customers).
    • Make your journey as complete as possible!
  1. Save your completed document. We don't want you to lose your work!
  2. To submit your results, refer to the instructions, click on [Start Assignment] and follow the upload steps.

Thank you!

assignments.description:
General assignment directions

  • How to Download and Submit Assignments

SHAPE your culture with AI!

---- start grid -----

SHAPE stands for Success, Habits, Actions, Passion, and Engage! How will you "SHAPE" your CX culture? For this assignment, you'll create your own special culture engagement concept - with the help of AI. Your project will engage employees in your new customer-first culture. It can be a poster, infographic, tip sheet, article, video, eBook, etc. You can even have employees sing, see, or do something. It’s up to YOU!

The only requirements are to use AI as your assistance and the project helps build your culture. If you wish, you can have others join you for this one!

---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Using AI as your assistant

Never used conversational AI before? Don't worry! We've created this easy-to-follow Workshop Guide with step-by-step instructions for ChatGPT. If you're using another AI assistant, these instructions can be easily applied. The guide even contains an example project walk-through and lots of project ideas. We hope you have fun!

---- start button -----

AI Creative Workshop Guide

---- end button -----

The guide contains the following Example AI Poster Project with directions.

---- start button -----

Example AI Poster Project

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Additional inspirations & ideas..

  • Viral video - Create a skit to convey what our culture is about or to reinforce a core value. It might go viral!
  • Activity - Perhaps create a game, hold a contest, or even host a Social Media contest themed around our culture. The zanier, the better!
  • Values poster - What is your favorite corporate value? How can you bring it to life? Create a fun poster that will get all employees “buzzing” about it.
  • Company song - Got a rap hidden inside you? A fun little melody you can put to words? Now’s the time to take the lead on this one! (Have an executive sing it too!)
  • Check out DYI ideas by searching the Internet for more fun ideas! Here's 77 Awesome Employee Engagement Ideas & Activities from Snacknation!
  • And remember to ask AI!
---- end grid -----

Instructions to complete assignment

  1. Start by downloading the AI Workshop Guide.
  2. Review the instructions and ideas. Find something you like and proceed.
  3. Complete your AMAZING culture project. This might be a poster, blog post, tip list, video, eBook, etc. The only requirements are:
    • You used AI as your "assistant" to create it.
    • The topic is relevant to CX, Customer First Culture, Employee Engagement, and this course.
    • Result is in a format you can submit (PDF, MP4, PNG, JPG, DOC, PPT, etc.)
  4. Save your completed work to submit your assignment.
  5. To submit your results, refer to the instructions, click on [Start Assignment] and follow the upload steps.

Thank you - we can't wait to see it!

assignments.description:
Welcome to your first assignment!

We want to make sure this experience is as easy for you as possible and all goes well. Many of the assignments for this program are provided as PDFs with a few in PowerPoint and Excel. It’s very important you download these documents first and save them for your own copy to work on. (Otherwise, you could lose all your work!)

Here are the steps that seem to work best for everyone. Please save this document to refer to as you complete your assignments!

  • How to Download and Submit Assignments

Download the worksheet

---- start grid -----

As professionals in the field of CX, understanding the existing CX initiatives within your company is paramount for several reasons. First, it allows you to build upon existing work, potentially expediting your CX goals. Second, it helps uncover gaps and overlaps. Third, you can learn from past successes and challenges to make informed decisions. Lastly, it fosters collaboration and aligns teams for a more holistic approach.

In this assignment, you'll explore your company's CX efforts, setting the stage for a more successful and customer-centric future. This not only enriches your professional knowledge but also contributes to your organization's competitive advantage in today's CX-focused market.

---- start button -----

CX Efforts at Your Company

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Instructions to complete this assignment

Most of our assignments are meant to be fast and easy. Don't worry about following writing rules - we're lenient! For some assignments, you may not know the answers to all questions. Now would be a good time to investigate your organization and gain insight from others. Ask around!

  1. Start by downloading the document.
  2. Save it to your desktop so you can edit it.
  3. Complete the assignment by following the instructions in the worksheet.
    • Check the boxes indicating "Customer Experience related" efforts underway in your company.
      • For example, if your company creates customer experience journey maps, check that box!
      • However, if your company creates system process or workflow maps instead, you would leave that box unchecked.
    • If you ARE able to check boxes, write a sentence or two describing how this works at your company.
      • For example, are these efforts a success?
      • Which group in your company drives these efforts?
    • If you're NOT able to check any boxes, add a note as to why... What might be stopping these efforts?
  4. Save your completed document so you don't lose your hard work!
  5. To submit your results, refer to the instructions, click on [Start Assignment] and follow the upload steps.

Thank you!

Download the worksheet

---- start grid -----

Examining your beloved brand through the "Warm FOSSE's" framework is deceptively simple yet essential. It uncovers your preferences, why you love the brand, and how it outshines competitors through sensory appeal, surprises, and simplification. Then, by pinpointing the aspects of "Engage" – the caring and trusting connections you feel with your beloved brand – you gain insight into the emotional connection that drives customer loyalty. Recognizing how your favorite brand nurtures these bonds can inspire you to do the same with your customers, leading to lasting relationships.

Later, your thoughts can serve as a source of inspiration to enhance your own CX strategy.

---- start button -----

The Warm FOSSE's

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Instructions to complete this assignment

  1. Start by downloading the document.
  2. Save it to your desktop so you can edit it.
  3. Complete the assignment by following the instructions in the worksheet.
    • Add the name of your favorite brand. Select this brand because you love it, you feel loyal to it, and you recommend it to others.
    • Come up with 2 customer experience reasons you are enamored about this brand. How do they make you feel? Why do you trust them?
    • Then, check the box(s) that best indicates the corresponding "Warm Fosse". (You can check more than one!)
  4. Save your completed document so you don't lose your hard work!
  5. To submit your results, refer to the instructions, click on [Start Assignment] and follow the upload steps.

Thank you!

This "Sucks" exercise helps you reflect on your negative brand encounters, pinpointing issues like trustworthiness, innovation, efficiency, complexity, and responsiveness. By analyzing these aspects, it offers valuable lessons on what not to do in your own CX strategy. Ultimately, it underscores the importance of delivering superior customer experiences by highlighting the consequences of failing to do so, both from a personal and professional standpoint.

---- start button -----

This Really “SUCKS”

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Instructions to complete this assignment

  1. Start by downloading the document.
  2. Save it to your desktop so you can edit it.
  3. Complete the assignment by following the instructions in the worksheet.
    • Describe a poor experience you've suffered through. How did that make you feel?
    • Check the box(s) best describing the type of experience.
      • Did it make you feel as thought the company was shifty, couldn't be trusted?
      • Was the experience unlovable?
      • Was the process clumsy, old and outdated?
      • Did it seem like it was knotted, convoluted, hard to untangle?
      • Was the experience slow, not reactive?
  4. Save your completed document so you don't lose your hard work!
  5. To submit your results, refer to the instructions, click on [Start Assignment] and follow the upload steps.

Thank you!

discussions.title: (Framework 10 of 13) Discussion: Conversations with AI
discussions.message:
First, watch the video

How did an AI chatbot go viral? There's a new chatbot in town that generates convincing human-like answers and it passed one million users in less than a week! ChatGPT was publicly released by OpenAI, an artificial intelligence research firm whose founders include Elon Musk. But the company has warned it can produce problematic answers and exhibit biased behavior. Open AI said it's "eager to collect user feedback to aid our ongoing work to improve this system".

Learn more and test this bot out at openai.com/

---- start grid -----

Next, download the poster

In 2023, over 70% of online conversations are expected to be with conversational AI systems. And why not? Bots provide 24/7 support, answer FAQs, and even offer promotions based on intent. This makes AI and bots a great customer experience solution - or are they? Here's a poster with several common uses for AI today that many of us may have already experienced.

---- start button -----

AI & Customer Experience

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

Review the poster and consider how you may have experienced many of these types of services. Have you talked to an AI chatbot lately?

Tell us about the most recent experience you've had with a chatbot - good or poor. Maybe it was for customer support, offering a promotion, maybe even reminding you to reorder.

  1. Describe the situation and if the end result was successful. What were your expectations and how did you personally "feel" about it?
  2. Then, give your experience a thumbs up or a thumbs down!
  3. Take a moment to vote on someone else's example, too.

discussions.title: (Job 3 of 13) Discussion: Disrupting the Workplace
discussions.message:
First, watch this video

The introduction of ChatGPT has ignited fresh concerns regarding the potential replacement of human jobs by AI, leading to redundancies and rendering certain job functions entirely obsolete. Additionally, the swift advancements in conversational AI implies these job losses may occur much sooner than anticipated. After all, why would organizations pay individuals to perform tasks that algorithms could execute effortlessly and without cost? Interestingly, according to a recent CNBC survey, a majority of workers do not harbor apprehensions about AI displacing their jobs. However, this sentiment is heavily contingent upon their specific job roles.

---- start grid -----

Next, download the poster

Although the CNBC survey results suggest that many workers are not concerned about the impact of AI on their jobs, some individuals still struggle to avoid panic when confronted with headlines proclaiming that AI will replace their occupations. It appears that every day brings news of accelerated advancements in artificial intelligence technologies. Nonetheless, those who have embraced early adoption are discovering that employing generative AI tools, such as OpenAI's ChatGPT, can optimize specific tasks and elevate creative projects, enabling them to allocate mental resources to more imaginative endeavors.

Feel free to download this poster, which highlights the potential AI opportunities for the future of work.

---- start button -----

AI: Embrace the Future of Work

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

Regardless of one's stance on the issue, it is undeniable that the latest advancements in AI are causing significant disruptions. We are interested in hearing your perspective!

  1. What's your outlook on how AI will disrupt your organization?
  2. Do you believe it will result in job losses for specific employees or empower them to work more efficiently?
  3. In what ways do you anticipate it might impact your own job role?

Let's be considerate of everyone and support one another in this learning journey!

discussions.title: (Intro 8 of 13) Discussion: Putting Your Trust in AI
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read this article

With AI tools increasing in sophistication and usefulness, people and industries are eager to deploy them to increase efficiency, save money, and inform human decision making. But are these tools ready for the real world? As any comic book fan knows: with great power comes great responsibility. The proliferation of AI raises questions about trust, bias, privacy, and safety, and there are few settled, simple answers. Read this article for our discussion.

---- start button -----

Can We Trust Artificial Intelligence?

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Talking about trust...

This 2023 article concerns Waymo (Way Forward in Mobile), the ride-hailing service which began as the Google self-driving car project in 2009. Read how one of their autonomous vehicles stopped in the middle of a key San Francisco intersection. Why? The complexity of unexpected temporary road closures and busy intersection resulted in the car not knowing what to do. In other words, the AI couldn't find the data to analyze the solution. (Don't worry - no one got hurt. The “rider assistance team” took over to resolve the issue.)

---- start button -----

Driverless car stops traffic

Did you know? As of January 2023, a total of 34 states have published legislation on autonomous vehicles.

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

Hitching a ride in a driverless car is just one example of how AI systems automate processes. But this might not automatically create trust and confidence!

  1. Considering your previous AI Strategy assignment, what's a primary action you'd take to ensure your AI efforts are trustworthy?
  2. Considering what you know about the state of AI today, would you feel perfectly safe as a passenger in a 100% driverless car? Explain why you feel this way and if there are certain situations you're concerned about.
  3. If you've already ridden in a driverless car, please share your feelings & experience with us!

discussions.title: (Intro 11 of 13) Discussion: AI Implementation
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read this article

To implement AI technologies, organizations need to focus on leadership and culture. When employees feel that AI can help enhance their performance and increase their job satisfaction, they will be more likely to embrace the technology and support the cultural transformation needed for AI's success. This article summarizes four key actions that companies should take to get their implementation right.

---- start button -----

Implement And Scale AI In Your Organization

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Next download the eBook

Enjoy this bonus eBook, An Executive’s Guide to Implementing AI, where we break down the complexities of AI implementation and guide you through the process. By following the insights and best practices outlined in this guide, we hope you'll be better-equipped to navigate the challenges and harness the potential of AI for your organization.

---- start button -----

Executive’s Guide to Implementing AI

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

In the article, the importance of "Investment in leadership and culture" was on the top of the list. Culture and training was mentioned several times in the eBook, as well.

  1. Considering your own company, tell us what would be on the top of their list.
  2. Share why this would come first and if you agree with this decision.
  3. Find one other person to reply to and encourage them on their journey!

discussions.title: (Framework 3 of 13) Discussion: Visual Machine Learning – What is Pizza?
discussions.message:
First, watch the video

AI learns what pizza is! As John pointed out in his previous video, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) is applied to enable deep learning for vision applications. We thought this video was a perfect example! Green Code decided to explore Pytorch and machine learning by teaching an AI model what Pizza is. They used CNNs, neural nets, and even some complex networks like VGG16 to help the AI recognize pizzas. Hope you enjoy the video!

Now, let's discuss!

  1. How might image recognition have an application in your own industry / business?
  2. If you’re already using it, please share!
  3. If not, what about in the future? Wave your magic wand and be creative!

discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read this article

Many HR professionals are already using a generative artificial intelligence tool to perform some of their daily tasks. While anxiety still remains about "robots taking our jobs," ChatGPT can make professionals more productive, freeing them up from repetitive tasks and allowing them to spend more time on strategic work. Read this article to learn more about the HR industry's use of AI!

---- start button -----

Beyond Job Descriptions

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

  2. What approach will you use to inform your employees that AI is a productivity tool that can save them hours of work?
  3. Let's embark on this journey together, supporting one another along the way! Take a moment to reply and offer assistance or encouragement to at least one other person.

discussions.title: (Job 11 of 13) Discussion: Welcome to Accessible AI!
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read this article

Welcome to the inflection point of AI, where ChatGPT and its underlying technology are revolutionizing work and reshaping businesses. With ChatGPT's widespread global popularity, we're witnessing the true public adoption and recognition of AI's transformative power. The potential for disruption is now evident to everyone, everywhere. Explore this article to step into the new era of generative AI that's accessible to all!

---- start button -----

A new era of generative AI for everyone

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Next, download the poster

As mentioned in the article, the possibilities of applying generative AI and foundation models are endless, offering companies countless ways to drive efficiency and gain a competitive edge. However, to extract business value from this transformative technology, organizations must embark on a journey of work reinvention. Business leaders hold the key to activate this change by redesigning jobs, reimagining tasks, and investing in reskilling initiatives. Grab a copy of this poster illustrating "how to capitalize on this step-change in AI capabilities" derived from this article!

---- start button -----

Capitalizing on AI Capabilities

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

As highlighted in the article, we stand at the dawn of an incredibly exciting era that will fundamentally transform the way we do business. For most of us, this isn't the first time technology has caused us concern to stay relevant in a rapidly evolving job market. It underscores the importance of reskilling, lifelong learning, adaptability, and resiliency.

In considering your own company:

  1. How does your organization promote a "continuous learning" mindset?
  2. What steps are you taking for the internal training and development needed to keep employees in the forefront of AI developments? (Do you feel prepared?)

discussions.title: (Industry 3 of 13) Discussion: The Future of Business is AI - or Obsolete
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read this article

As AI language and vision technology continues to advance, it becomes increasingly evident that businesses in every industry will fall into one of three categories: AI Native, AI Emergent, or Obsolete. Each passing day brings us closer to a future where these distinctions define a business's ability to adapt and thrive in the AI-driven landscape. Read this article to learn more and explore the three options your company has moving forward!

---- start button -----

The Future of Business Is AI - or Obsolete

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

After reviewing all the factors mentioned in the article, it's easy to see how the stage is set for wide-scale disruption and once-in-a-lifetime opportunities for businesses and careers.

  1. Where do you feel your own company fits - AI Native, AI Emergent, or Obsolete? Perhaps in-between? Please explain why.
  2. What's your own opinion - do you feel the future is AI or obsolete?

discussions.title: (Industry 7 of 13) Discussion: Automation & the Future of Work
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read this article

The future of work is poised to undergo significant transformations, driven by AI, automation, and advanced engineered systems. These advancements hold the potential to enhance safety, simplify routine tasks, and boost productivity in organizations. Although there are ethical considerations, it's crucial to recognize the undeniable improvements automation can bring to the experience. Read this article to learn how engineered systems are improving the workplace!

---- start button -----

Automation and the Future of Work

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

This article provides 3 examples of companies using AI to improve the safety and hiring of employees. Let's discuss the impact of AI on workplace safety and employee well-being, as exemplified by SOBEREYE.

  1. What do you feel are the potential benefits and possible drawbacks of such AI-powered systems? Consider the effect on workplace culture.
  2. What do you feel are the ethical considerations associated with the collection and analysis of personal data for safety monitoring purposes? Think about privacy factors, as well as data security.
  3. Remember to support each other! Reply with encouragement to at least one other person.

discussions.title: (Industry 11 of 13) Discussion: Learning to Trust AI Colleagues
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read this article

The level of trust established between businesses, workers, and their AI "colleagues" holds significant importance in determining business success. With many organizations embracing a data-driven approach and identifying as AI-fueled companies, evidence suggests that pervasive AI integration across operations leads to higher performance. Enterprises with an AI strategy are 1.7 times more likely to achieve their goals compared to those lacking such a visionary approach. Read this article for the discussion!

---- start button -----

Learning to Trust AI Colleagues

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Bonus insights report

Not required for this discussion, but we thought you might like the full Tech Trends 2023 Deloitte Insights Report to learn how, as our information systems continue to advance, machine intelligence itself will become increasingly well rounded. We may soon see the rise of general-purpose AI!

---- start button -----

Tech Trends 2003 Report

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

Knowing the importance of trust in AI and the challenges businesses face in establishing trust with their AI "colleagues", let's discuss the factors that influence trust in AI systems. Also, check what others are saying for ideas!

  1. Briefly describe your opinion on the implications of trust in AI on business success, customer relationships, and the future of work?
  2. List factors you feel might influence trust and adoption in AI within your own organization?
  3. What steps do you feel can be taken to help your company's culture (including executives) trust their AI "colleagues"?

discussions.title: (Innovation 3 of 16) Discussion: Using AI to Save Our Planet
discussions.message:

The potential of AI helping us tackle environmental challenges is immense. This poster showcases six key areas where AI's prowess is already making a significant difference, offering practical solutions and innovative approaches to safeguarding our natural world. From AI-powered drones surveying ecosystems to AI algorithms predicting climate patterns, precision agriculture, energy efficiency optimization, wildlife conservation, and waste management, AI is bridging the gap between technology and environmental stewardship.

---- start button -----

Six Ways AI Can Save Our Planet!

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

As this poster suggests, AI can help us with practical solutions and innovative approaches to safeguarding our natural world. Let's share a few thoughts, insights, and concerns about the role of AI in environmental protection and these "Six cool ways".

  1. What do you feel are the potential risks or unintended consequences associated with relying heavily on AI-based technologies for environmental protection?
  2. Do you have concerns around ethical consequences to implementing AI technologies in agriculture? Please describe.

discussions.message:
First, watch this video

AI serves as a remarkable tool for designing innovative products, but the question arises: Will it ever completely replace the value that a product designer brings to the development process? While A.I. has shown immense potential in generating creative ideas, optimizing designs, and streamlining certain aspects of the development cycle, it seems unlikely to entirely replace the unique contributions of a human product designer. Or, does it?

Now, let's discuss!

How do you feel about this? Will AI replace designers eventually? Do you need to employ a design company anymore or can you just use ChatGPT and Midjourney? Tell us your opinion. Please reply to one other to encourage them!

discussions.title: (Concerns 3 of 13) Discussion: Can We Eliminate AI Bias?
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read the article

Imagine a showdown between a computer and a human, competing for neutrality. Many would assume the machine has the upper hand. However, let's rethink the question. Computers are the brainchild of humans, designed and trained by us to power the marvels of modern technology. But here's the catch: the biases ingrained in these systems often mirror the biases of their human creators! Read this article for our discussion.

---- start button -----

AI Automated Discrimination & How to Spot It

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

  1. What do you feel is the biggest ethical issue an organization should consider to mitigate bias when developing an AI system?
  2. In reference to your own company, has this already been identified as a major risk? If not, why not?

discussions.title: (Concerns 7 of 13) Discussion: Can AI Go Green?
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read the article

The field of artificial intelligence has experienced an incredible surge in recent months. We've witnessed the emergence of remarkable models like Dall-E and GPT-4, flooding the landscape with wave after wave of innovation. Each passing week brings fresh promises of exciting models, products, and tools. It's truly captivating, yet we must not overlook the genuine costs associated with these alluring advancements. But, behind the shiny facade, there are significant downsides that impact both society and the planet. Read this article to learn more.

---- start button -----

The mounting costs of generative AI

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Next, download the poster

As the development of generative AI continues to advance, it becomes increasingly important to address the mounting human and environmental costs associated with this technology. This poster aims to raise awareness and provide actionable steps to correct the course, ensuring that AI development aligns with sustainability principles. By engaging in open dialogue and adopting responsible practices, we can pave the way for a more ethical and environmentally conscious AI landscape.

---- start button -----

Sustainable AI for a Better Future

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

While it's easy to get swept up in the wave of hype, it's vital to remain cognizant of the real-world consequences. We must strive for responsible AI development that considers the environmental impact, values human resources, and addresses the escalating costs. Together, we can harness the power of AI while being mindful of the costs it imposes on society and our planet.

  1. Was this insight into the environmental impact of the AI footprint a surprise for you? Describe why or why not.
  2. What can you suggest to your company to help improve this impact?

discussions.title: (Concerns 11 of 13) Discussion: Navigating the AI Revolution
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read the article

The adoption of ChatGPT has been the fastest in tech history, with a staggering 100 million users in just two months (it took Uber 70, Spotify 55, and Instagram 30, respectively, to get to the same user numbers). Prominent technologists, including Elon Musk and Steve Wozniak, have come together to express their concerns. In an open letter, they urged AI labs to cease current efforts in developing their potent AI systems and advocated for a pause. By taking a step back from this "out-of-control race," they emphasized the importance of fully understanding potential dangers. Read this insightful article for this discussion.

---- start button -----

Navigating the AI Revolution

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

  1. How do you feel about the lightening speed of this "generative AI locomotive"?
  2. Should we slow down, or is it now too late to call the train back to the station?
  3. What might be the implications to your own industry if it continues to race out of control?

discussions.title: (Impact 3 of 13) Discussion: Use Case ROI & Business Value
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, download the eBook

As businesses continue to adopt AI technologies, it becomes increasingly essential to measure and demonstrate the return on investment (ROI) of these initiatives accurately. In this eBook, we walk you through a systematic approach, enabling you to make informed decisions, optimize strategies, and maximize the value AI brings to your organization. Implementing these strategies will enable your organization to harness the full potential and value AI brings to your business.

Download this 5-step guide and review the included use cases to navigate the complex landscape of quantifying AI ROI.

---- start button -----

AI: 5-Step Guide to ROI

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

When considering the two use cases illustrated in this eBook (starting on pages 8 and 11), think about these examples and your own company.

  1. What would be the number one area of your company that might have a great use case for AI ROI?
  2. What might be a roadblock to demonstrating a true business value for this use case? (For example, inability to track benefits, challenge to connect the dots, unable to get full-burdened costs, etc.)

discussions.title: (Impact 7 of 13) Discussion: AI Vendors - Are You Ready?
discussions.message:
---- start grid -----

First, read the article

Choosing the right AI vendor has become a critical decision for organizations looking to leverage the power of AI. With a plethora of vendors and solutions available, and a hard sell around every corner, no wonder it's confusing. However, it’s essential to navigate this complex landscape strategically to achieve success.

---- start button -----

Tips on Choosing the Right AI Vendor

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----
---- start grid -----

Next, grab your copy of the worksheet!

This user-friendly tool provides a list of essential questions to assist you in making informed decisions when selecting the right vendor for your organization. Check the tabs for questions to ask dashboard suppliers and AI & ML services vendors. This spreadsheet provides an organized view of your evaluation process, while the questions cover crucial aspects such as features, user interface, data handling, algorithms, security, support, and cost. We hope this spreadsheet will help you select the best-fit partner for your AI initiatives!

---- start button -----

Questions to ask AI Vendors XLS

---- end button -----
---- end grid -----

Now, let's discuss!

After reading the article and reviewing the spreadsheet, what do you think?

  1. Do you feel your company is well prepared to choose the right AI vendor for your business (or are you worried)?
  2. Will the questions on this spreadsheet help your vendor selection process?
  3. Lastly, does your company already have a well-calculated AI vendor selection process in place? (Such as vendor rating and scoring.) If so, please share how this works so others will learn from your experience!

The impact of AI in HR is profound, transforming processes, increasing productivity, and driving efficiency. From tackling employee disengagement to optimizing talent acquisition, there's an immense potential of reshaping the HR landscape. Review this article to learn some top trends and statistics that explain the growing significance of AI in Human Resource.

AI in HR Top Trends

  2. Share with us if any of these trends are already making an impact at your own company. You may need to ask HR on this one!
  3. Let's remember to support each other! Please reply to at least one other person.
